an4.19:1.3.pli: Chandāgatiṁ gacchati, dosāgatiṁ gacchati, mohāgatiṁ gacchati, bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.19:1.3.en: Making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an4.19:2.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.19:2.3.en: Making decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an4.19:3.2.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,

an4.19:4.2.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,

dn31:5.2.pli: Chandāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, dosāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, mohāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, bhayāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti.
dn31:5.2.en: One does bad deeds prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

dn31:5.3.pli: Yato kho, gahapatiputta, ariyasāvako neva chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati;
dn31:5.3.en: When a noble disciple is not prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice,

dn31:6.2.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,

dn31:6.6.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,

an5.272:1.3.pli: Chandāgatiṁ gacchati, dosāgatiṁ gacchati, mohāgatiṁ gacchati, bhayāgatiṁ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṁ na jānāti.
an5.272:1.3.en: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they don’t know if a meal has been assigned or not.

an5.272:2.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṁ jānāti.
an5.272:2.3.en: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a meal has been assigned or not.

an5.272:3.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṁ jānāti.
an5.272:3.3.en: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a meal has been assigned or not.

272. A Meal Assigner

an4.17:1.3.pli: Chandāgatiṁ gacchati, dosāgatiṁ gacchati, mohāgatiṁ gacchati, bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.17:1.3.en: Making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an4.17:2.2.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,

an4.18:1.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.18:1.3.en: Making decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an4.18:2.2.en: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,

an4.20:1.3.pli: Chandāgatiṁ gacchati, dosāgatiṁ gacchati, mohāgatiṁ gacchati, bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.20:1.3.en: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an4.20:2.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati—
an4.20:2.3.en: They make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an2.46:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū chandāgatiṁ gacchanti, dosāgatiṁ gacchanti, mohāgatiṁ gacchanti, bhayāgatiṁ gacchanti.
an2.46:1.5.en: An assembly where the mendicants make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an2.46:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū na chandāgatiṁ gacchanti, na dosāgatiṁ gacchanti, na mohāgatiṁ gacchanti, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchanti.
an2.46:2.2.en: An assembly where the mendicants make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

an9.7:3.4.pli: abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sañcicca pāṇaṁ jīvitā voropetuṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu adinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādātuṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevituṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sampajānamusā bhāsituṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sannidhikārakaṁ kāme paribhuñjituṁ seyyathāpi pubbe agāriyabhūto, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu chandāgatiṁ gantuṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu dosāgatiṁ gantuṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu mohāgatiṁ gantuṁ, abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu bhayāgatiṁ gantuṁ’.
an9.7:3.4.en: A mendicant with defilements ended can’t deliberately take the life of a living creature, take something with the intention to steal, have sex, tell a deliberate lie, or store up goods for their own enjoyment like they did as a lay person. And they can’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, or cowardice.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9
1. Awakening
7. With Sutavā the Wanderer

an5.273-285:14.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati, pesitāpesitaṁ jānāti.
an5.273-285:14.3.en: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a novice has been supervised or not.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
27. Abbreviated Texts on Appointments
273–285. A Lodgings Assigner

dn29:26.8.pli: Abhabbo, āvuso, khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sañcicca pāṇaṁ jīvitā voropetuṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu adinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādiyituṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevituṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sampajānamusā bhāsituṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu sannidhikārakaṁ kāme paribhuñjituṁ, seyyathāpi pubbe āgārikabhūto; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu chandāgatiṁ gantuṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu dosāgatiṁ gantuṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu mohāgatiṁ gantuṁ; abhabbo khīṇāsavo bhikkhu bhayāgatiṁ gantuṁ.
dn29:26.8.en: A mendicant with defilements ended can’t deliberately take the life of a living creature, take something with the intention to steal, have sex, tell a deliberate lie, or store up goods for their own enjoyment like they did as a lay person. And they can’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, or cowardice.

dn33:1.11.128.pli: chandāgatiṁ gacchati, dosāgatiṁ gacchati, mohāgatiṁ gacchati, bhayāgatiṁ gacchati.
dn33:1.11.128.en: making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
